intro: Boeica brachyandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boeica, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and coastal winds. Boeica brachyandra is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
